image.altText: Several fire trucks line a street, surrounded by smoke.

props.synopsis: WA Police say the person was found deceased after the fire was extinguished.

title.children: One dead in major blaze at warehouse in Perth's southern suburbs

image.altText: Dr Saul Karnovsky in his office at Curtin University in Perth looking and writing notes.

props.synopsis: An education researcher warns burnout is driving teachers out of the profession in droves and staff shortages in schools across the country next year will be far worse than authorities are predicting.

title.children: 'The pay's not the issue': Burnout causing teachers to quit, prompting staff shortage concerns

image.altText: Frank Nelson wearing a West Coast Eagles beanie and resting his hand on a white sign.

props.synopsis: Police in WA's South West are desperately searching for a man in his 60s believed to have been canoeing on the Murray River early on Saturday morning.

title.children: Desperate search for man after canoe and paddle found floating on Murray River, south of Perth

image.altText: Closeup of small turtle being held in front of grasslands.

props.synopsis: An endangered tortoise that excited wildlife carers by surviving outside its only known habitats in Perth has returned home to its birthplace and site of a relocation trial in WA's South West.

title.children: Hopes for future hatchlings outside Perth as rare western swamp tortoise returns to southern home

image.altText: Jim Chalmers in an interview with Insiders. The brisbane city landscape is behind him

props.synopsis: Questions on both sexual orientation and gender will feature in Australia's next census, as the federal government seeks to repair the fallout from earlier efforts to abandon questions about LGBTIQ+ identity.

title.children: Sexual orientation and gender questions to feature in next census

image.altText: A man in a white coat touching a Tomahawk cruise missile

props.synopsis: An American weapons company made illegal technology transfers to Australia at the same time some of its staff members took work laptops containing sensitive military secrets into Russia and Iran.

title.children: Australian links revealed in global defence company scandal involving China, Russia and Iran

image.altText: Actress Nicole Kidman with her mother Janelle Ann Kidman as they attend the 2018 AACTA Awards

props.synopsis: The Australian actress leaves the film festival after learning the news her mother had died aged 84.

title.children: Nicole Kidman reveals mother's death in Venice Film Festival acceptance speech

image.altText: Whale in ocean with rope wrapped around it's tail

props.synopsis: Authorities so far fail to locate a humpback whale seen entangled in rope and dragging a buoy behind it in WA's South West.

title.children: Search for humpback whale seen wrapped in rope and dragging a buoy continues

image.altText: Jacqueline McGowan-Jones wears a purple jacket and has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: WA's top child advocate watched in horror as the government referenced her "glowing" assessment of the youth detention centre where another teenage boy died in custody, and was devastated her observations were taken "out of context".

title.children: 'Devastated' children's commissioner claims WA government misrepresented her in wake of detainee death

image.altText: Composite of Rupert Murdoch, his two daughters and two sons

props.synopsis: Lachlan Murdoch turns 53 today, his first birthday since taking over the family's media empire from his father Rupert in November. And if he finds himself in a contemplative state of mind, how might he reflect upon the great balance sheet of life?

title.children: A dynasty divided: Lachlan Murdoch won the succession battle but at what cost?

image.altText: Curtis McGrath celebrates winning gold at Paris Paralympics.

props.synopsis: Australia finishes the swimming and athletics programs at the Paris Paralympics with a string of medals, as Australian para-canoeist Curtis McGrath wins the kayak single 200 KL2 title for the third straight Games.

title.children: Curtis McGrath and James Turner win gold in para-canoe and athletics, as Dolphins finish swimming program in style

image.altText: A man with white hair wearing a suit gesturing with both hands open to the side as if asking why

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu has built a proud reputation of being known as Mr Security, but now there's a new moniker that's being attached to him — Mr Death.

title.children: Even with the nickname 'Mr Death', Netanyahu seems invincible. One thing could bring him down

image.altText: an aerial photo of some solar panels

props.synopsis: As Australia's electricity system gets cleaner, it is encountering a strange problem. More renewable energy is having to be wasted.

title.children: Australia is 'wasting' record amounts of green energy. Here's why experts say it's a good thing

image.altText: King Charles and Queen Camilla pose formally in dress wear in an ornate room with gold furnishing.

props.synopsis: King Charles has been dragged into a Senate drama over an obscure push to remove references to Queen Elizabeth from Australia's laws.

title.children: A royal clean-up sparks Senate fight over King Charles

image.altText: A close up image of a man wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Two new reports paint a picture of an overburdened and under-resourced mental health system, with about 75 per cent of Australians feeling elevated levels of distress compared to the same time last year.

title.children: Linda felt let down after her husband died by suicide.  Two decades later, people are still falling through the cracks

image.altText: A bright electronic billboard advertising the turquoise waters of Fiji in a neon lit streetscape in China.

props.synopsis: As Palau's president tangled with China over tourist numbers, other Pacific Island nations were looking to its giant market of travellers to fill their resorts and hotels.

title.children: 'The bad guy is the first to complain': Is China 'weaponising' tourism in the Pacific?

image.altText: A man, Brett Button, standing in a crowd of people with news cameras surrounding him

props.synopsis: Ten people died when the bus Brett Andrew Button was driving crashed on the way home from a wedding. This week he is expected to receive a jail term, but not before hearing from dozens of the victims' family and friends and those who survived the crash.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus crash driver to come face to face with devastated loved ones of those killed

image.altText: Max Purcell and Jordan Thompson hold aloft the US Open men's doubles trophy

props.synopsis: Jordan Thompson and Max Purcell have crowned Australia's spirited US Open campaign with a redemption triumph in the men's doubles final.

title.children: Aussies Thompson and Purcell win US Open doubles crown

image.altText: A close up of the Queen smiling in a purple coat and matching hat.

props.synopsis: Two years ago an important chapter in royal history came to a full stop with the death of Queen Elizabeth II. Everything was about to change.

title.children: The Queen was dead; long live King Charles. Then everything changed

image.altText: A young boy in a spiderman outfit with a grey picture in the background of people searching a bush.

props.synopsis: A decade after the boy in the Spider-Man suit vanished from his foster grandmother's home on the NSW Mid North Coast, police are no closer to finding him.

title.children: Why we may never know what happened to William Tyrrell

image.altText: A man and two women looking at the camera, pictured standing on a staircase.

props.synopsis: With the Nationals eyeing metropolitan seats and the entire state up for grabs in the upper house, contests like the one shaping up in the Goldfields provide a blueprint for how the 2025 election might play out.

title.children: Three-cornered contests will shape the next WA parliament. This regional city is a good example of how they play out

image.altText: Q+A/YouGov Poll: 09 September 2024

props.synopsis: Most Australians are happy for the value of their homes to fall to make housing more affordable, a new Q+A/YouGov poll finds, with voters giving their verdict on policy solutions.

title.children: Rob super, end tax breaks: Australia's verdict on fixing housing policy

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka holds the US Open trophy

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka was forced to dig deep in both sets of a straight-sets win over America's Jessica Pegula to win her third career grand slam title.

title.children: 'I was literally praying': Aryna Sabalenka left 'speechless' after surviving tense US Open final

image.altText: A copse of palm trees with leaves all swept to the right seemingly by strong wind.

props.synopsis: Super Typhoon Yagi makes landfall in Vietnam, uprooting thousands of trees, sweeping ships and boats out to sea and killing at least one person.

title.children: Super Typhoon Yagi kills four people and injures dozens of others in Vietnam after battering Philippines and China

image.altText: Heilum Luki celebrates a try

props.synopsis: The Panthers hang on to secure a home final by beating the Titans in an error-strewn display, the Cowboys secure a home final by smashing the Bulldogs and the Raiders keep their faint hopes alive with a stunning come-from-behind victory over the Dragons.

title.children: Cowboys send out warning with pre-finals thrashing of the Bulldogs

image.altText: An old photo of a several men carrying a stretcher through mud.

props.synopsis: It’s been 25 years since Timor Leste’s referendum to end Indonesian occupation sparked brutal violence from the withdrawing forces.

title.children: 'Dili was on fire': A humanitarian crisis unfolded on Darwin's doorstep 25 years ago

image.altText: Tennis player Jannik Sinner sits in a chair at courtside and reacts in pain as a medic examines his wrist during a big match.

props.synopsis: A chaotic US Open semifinal sees Jannik Sinner play through the pain barrier to beat Jack Draper after the ailing Briton throws up repeatedly on court — now the world number one will face American Taylor Fritz in the final.

title.children: Injured Jannik Sinner downs ailing Jack Draper to reach US Open final

image.altText: Man wearing red headlamp testing astronomy equipment at dusk

props.synopsis: At an unassuming truck stop in outback Queensland, three men meet up for an evening of stargazing. The amateur astronomers are part of a group formed more than 30 years ago that's as much about friendship at it is about finding Saturn in the night sky.

title.children: Outback amateur astronomers love spotting the 'strange stuff out here' — and only some of it is embellished

image.altText: A man wearing a military uniform looking on.

props.synopsis: Ukraine has managed to capture more territory in a month than Russia has in a year, but with troops stretched and Putin's forces closing in on a key transport hub, some are questioning whether Kyiv's surprise invasion of the Kursk region was a good idea.

title.children: Ukraine's invasion of Russia was seen by some as a masterstroke, but it might backfire

image.altText: A squat, round white space capsule sits on sandy ground at night with a light on inside it, surrounded by golden material.

props.synopsis: After months of turmoil over its safety, Boeing's new space capsule departs the International Space Station and lands in New Mexico — without its astronauts.

title.children: Boeing's troubled Starliner capsule returns to Earth empty, leaving astronauts waiting on ISS

image.altText: Ayşenur Ezgi Eygi wears a graduation cap and a keffiyeh and holds a bunch of pink flowers while standing on a roadside.

props.synopsis: The White House says it is "deeply disturbed" after a 26-year-old activist, a dual US-Turkish citizen, was killed during a protest in the occupied West Bank. Witnesses say she was shot in the head by Israeli soldiers.

title.children: American woman shot dead by Israeli forces during West Bank protest, witnesses say

image.altText: William Gulson leaves parramatta court after being charged with grooming a child online

props.synopsis: English teacher William Gulson, 27, has been charged with grooming a child online.

title.children: Teacher from Knox Grammar allegedly asked 15yo if they 'found it hot' being the same age as his students

image.altText: elderly people dance outside

props.synopsis: In response to an aging population and growing pressure on pensions, the Chinese Communist Party plans to raise the statutory retirement age – which currently stands as low as 50 years old for some workers.

title.children: 'Never popular': Beijing seeks to raise the country's low retirement age

image.altText: A close up of Taylor Swift wearing a black corset top and raising a glass at a football game.

props.synopsis: Earlier this year, Australian designer Dion Lee was making waves in the fashion world after his corset top was debuted by the most famous woman in the world. How did all go so wrong for this local brand?

title.children: Just months ago, Dion Lee was dressing Taylor Swift. How did it go so wrong for this Australian brand?
